column5: I spent the last 3 days fishing on Lake Toho, just outside of Orlando, Florida.  The fish are in the pre-spawn, spawn and post-spawn stages.  It was a real mixed bag.  I caught 37 fish over the 3 days - 33 largemouth, 2 gar, and 2 chain pickerel (pike - very similar to Northern).  The largemouth averaged around 5 pounds, and on the final day I finally managed to reach my goal of landing fish over 10 pounds.  To say that it was an amazing experience is a huge understatement!  The fishing was done with a combination of live shiners and artificials.  Most of the fish were caught on the shiners in water that averaged 6 feet deep.  Loads of hydrilla ..... a really typical Florida bass lake.  I have only included a few of the pictures from the 3 days.  You can see in one of them, that the fish is about to spawn.  That will probably happen today on the new moon.
Wow, sweet Bass.  Congrats on breaking the 10 lb. mark. Posts like that keep the sanity in check til Bass season opens here. Wouldn't mind fishing in my shorts this weekend either...   Hookset.
very nice,congrats
Great big fish you got there, Michael. Congrats to you on your PB bass and thanks for sharing that with us.
Congrats on the PB, thats one huge bass.
Awesome Bass!!! Have fished Toho a couple of times and you are right about all the hydrilla. Congrats on breaking the double digits!!  Cheers, 1leg
Awesome fish!!  Congrats on the PB!
Very cool!  Congrats on that 10 pounder!
Nice fish!!  Who was your guide? Looks like the same boat I am in in my avatar picture.
Stoty:  My guide was Jack Mitchell.  Great guy.  I had a blast.  Michael

Mighty impressive Mike.  Congrats to you. My Grandfather lived in St. Cloud, just across the street from West Toho (I think it is called).   Spent a few evenings sitting on one of the piers fishing, but had no luck.  Of course, this was back in the early 70's whe we went down for visiting and vacation. I've never caught one anywhere near that weight ... maybe close to half of that. Again - congrats on the large bucket mouth.
Congrats.
Holy crap!  Nice fish.......  would be nice to get down there and catch me one of them.
Congrats on the PB!!  10lbs.....can't even imagine.  Thanks for sharing that Micheal.
I dont fish bass at all but Ive got to say they're some hogs there Son! WTG....and congrats on the #10. bNb
MiachaelW, you are my hero!! Congratulations
Those are some hogs, gotta love Florida shiner fishing!  -Ben
Nice fish!
wow that is a great report!  i woudl love to catch a 10 pounder my only problem is i want it to be over 10.43 and i want it to be in ontario lol  Congrats on the monster bass!  Cheers!
that's a truck !!!!...wish to get down there myself one day......LOL, did you get razzed for the LEAF sweater  !!
jdmis - it is actually a roots sweater - looks a lot like a Leafs sweater ....... without the Leafs name on it!
Awesome fish Michael, and congratulations on reaching a  milestone that  most Canadian bass fishemen/ladies can only dream of !!
beauty!
WHAT A PORKY BUCKETcongrats on your PB Bass
